application.name: kaguyatc2isis
application.brief: Import L2B0 or L2B2 Kaguya TC image to ISIS cube.
application.description: This program will import a "PDS-like" formatted Kaguya Terrain Camera (TC) level 2 image (including level 2B0 and 2B2) from the JAXA Kaguya archive to ISIS. Note that not all TC images may be supported by this program. Supported input images include radiometrically corrected unprojected images, TC maps, or TC Ortho maps. To verify, input image labels must have DATA_SET_ID matching TC1_Level2B, TC2_Level2B, TC_MAP or TCO_MAP.

history.change: Added support for Terrain Camera Ortho TCO_MAP.
Added parameters (SETNULLRANGE, SETHRSRANGE, SETHISRANGE, SETLRSRANGE, SETLISRANGE) to allow the user to specify special pixel values. Fixes #1718.
Added check for TARGET_NAME keyword. Fixes #2036.
Added support for Kaguya L2B0 (TC1_Level2B and TC2_Level2B) files.
Updated description provided by Lisa Gaddis.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.brief: Input PDS formatted Kaguya Terrain Camera level 2 file
parameter.description: Use this parameter to select the Kaguya Terrain Camera filename. This file must contain the PDS labels.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: Use this parameter to select the output filename

parameter.name: SETNULLRANGE
parameter.brief: Option to convert pixel values to NULL
parameter.description: If this option is set to "yes" or "true", a range of input raw pixels defined by the NULLMIN and NULLMAX parameters are converted to NULL pixels. All other valid pixels that do not fall within the ranges specified for LIS, LRS, HIS, and HRS pixels are transferred to the output file unchanged. If the bit type of the input file is changed, the NULL and HRS special pixels may be incorrectly set to valid pixel values. For example, if a raw 8-bit file is output to 16 or 32-bit, the pixel values "0" and "255" may be converted to actual values instead of retaining the special pixel property. If the output file remains as 8-bit, then "0" stays as NULL and "255" stays as HRS.

parameter.name: NULLMIN
parameter.description: Minimum pixel value to set to NULL. All values greater than or equal to NULLMIN and less than or equal to NULLMAX are converted to NULL.

parameter.name: NULLMAX
parameter.description: Maximum pixel value to set to NULL. All values greater than or equal to NULLMIN and less than or equal to NULLMAX are converted to NULL.

parameter.name: SETHRSRANGE
parameter.brief: Option to convert pixel values to HRS
parameter.description: If this option is set to "yes" or "true", a range of input raw pixels defined by the HRSMIN and HRSMAX parameters are converted to HRS pixels. All other valid pixels that do not fall within the ranges specified for LIS, LRS, HIS, and NULL pixels are transferred to the output file unchanged. If the bit type of the input file is changed, the NULL and HRS special pixels may be incorrectly set to valid pixel values. For example, if a raw 8-bit file is output to 16 or 32-bit, the pixel values "0" and "255" may be converted to actual values instead of retaining the special pixel property. If the output file remains as 8-bit, then "0" stays as NULL and "255" stays as HRS.

parameter.name: HRSMIN
parameter.description: Minimum pixel value to set to HRS. All values greater than or equal to HRSMIN and less than or equal to HRSMAX are converted to HRS.

parameter.name: HRSMAX
parameter.description: Maximum pixel value to set to HRS. All values greater than or equal to HRSMIN and less than or equal to HRSMAX are converted to HRS.

parameter.name: SETHISRANGE
parameter.brief: Option to convert pixel values to HIS
parameter.description: If this option is set to "yes" or "true", a range of input raw pixels defined by the HISMIN and HISMAX parameters are converted to HIS pixels. All other valid pixels that do not fall within the ranges specified for LIS, LRS, HRS, and NULL pixels are transferred to the output file unchanged.

parameter.name: HISMIN
parameter.description: Minimum pixel value to set to HIS. All values greater than or equal to HISMIN and less than or equal to HISMAX are converted to HIS.

parameter.name: HISMAX
parameter.description: Maximum pixel value to set to HIS. All values greater than or equal to HISMIN and less than or equal to HISMAX are converted to HIS.

parameter.name: SETLRSRANGE
parameter.brief: Option to convert pixel values to LRS
parameter.description: If this option is set to "yes" or "true", a range of input raw pixels defined by the LRSMIN and LRSMAX parameters are converted to LRS pixels. All other valid pixels that do not fall within the ranges specified for LIS, HIS, HRS, and NULL pixels are transferred to the output file unchanged.

parameter.name: LRSMIN
parameter.description: Minimum pixel value to set to LRS. All values greater than or equal to LRSMIN and less than or equal to LRSMAX are converted to LRS.

parameter.name: LRSMAX
parameter.description: Maximum pixel value to set to LRS. All values greater than or equal to LRSMIN and less than or equal to LRSMAX are converted to LRS.

parameter.name: SETLISRANGE
parameter.brief: Option to convert pixel values to LIS
parameter.description: If this option is set to "yes" or "true", a range of input raw pixels defined by the LISMIN and LISMAX parameters are converted to LIS pixels. All other valid pixels that do not fall within the ranges specified for LRS, HIS, HRS, and NULL pixels are transferred to the output file unchanged.

parameter.name: LISMIN
parameter.description: Minimum pixel value to set to LIS. All values greater than or equal to LISMIN and less than or equal to LISMAX are converted to LIS.

parameter.name: LISMAX
parameter.description: Maximum pixel value to set to LIS. All values greater than or equal to LISMIN and less than or equal to LISMAX are converted to LIS.
